713312f-b.text:
48th Street, left from First Ave. (After Reconstruction). President Borough of Manhatten.
August 15, 1918.

713312f-a.text:
48th Street, left from First Ave. (After Reconstruction). President Borough of Manhatten.
August 15, 1918.

707618f-a.text:
West side of First Avenue across clearing, 49th to 48th Streets. October 24th, 1928.
F.L. Sperr, Photographer.

707616f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, north from and including 48th Street. The approach to the Queensboro Bridge may be seen on the horizon. The tall apartment house on the S.E. corner of 49th Street was built early in 1929. The building on the N.E. corner of 49th Street (Mitchell Place) is the Pan-Hellenic Building, a residence for sorority girls and sorority clubs; it was built in the spring
and summer of 1928.
July 3, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

707617f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, north from E. 48th Street, showing prominently the Beekman Towers at Mitchel Place (E. 50th Street). Silhouetted against same is a modern apartment house at the S.E.
corner.
July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707619f-b.text:
First Avenue, south from E. 49th Street, showing a view towards Tudor City and the Wilson packing plant. In the foreground are two new apartment houses forming a portion of the locale identified as Beekman Hill. View 2 is limited to the west side of this thoroughfare from a point between 49th to 48th Streets.
View 1: June 23, 1930
View 2: Fehruary 9, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707619f-a.text:
First Avenue, south from E. 49th Street, showing a view towards Tudor City and the Wilson packing plant.
